course.title: Latin America and the United States
course.description: Surveys the complex, mutually constitutive, and often thorny relationship - characterized by suspicion and antagonism, but also by fascination and desire - between the United States and the diverse republics south of the Rio Grande. Examines public policy, US expansionism and empire, popular culture and consumption, competing economic development models, migration, tourism, the Cold War, sovereignty, dissent, and contrasting visions of democratic citizenship.
course.notes: This course, when taken for a letter grade, meets the General Education requirement for United States in the World. This course fulfills the requirement that one of the eight General Education courses also engage substantially with Study of the Past.
